CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 23, 1946, pg. 17, reads: "Homemakers - These Junior Misses shown above are preparing themselves for active participation in improving conditions in their respective neighborhoods, in addition to being more efficient in home. In preparation for the duties that befall 'the woman in the home,' they are learning these techniques at Hill City. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Eunice Cook overseeing girl making bed, with three other girls watching, and chalkboard inscribed "1. Bed making, 2. Bed making with patient in bed, 3. Bed Bath, 4. Feeding the sick patient,  5. Bathing the baby, 6. Making pads for the baby's bed, 7. Make bags out of newspaper," Hill City
